body:
<!-- Describe the issue -->
Running bitocind in newest MacOS Ventura crashes randomly, but not on previous MacOS versions. I can confirm it works on my other MBP (Monterey) as I managed to download the whole chain without any issues.

**Expected behavior**
To keep syncing blocks

**Actual behavior**
Fails at random blocks for Ventura.

**To reproduce**
Try syncing the chain either via bitcoin gui or bitcoin cli on MacOS Ventura!

**System information**
Machine: Apple MBP M1 16GB MacOS Ventura 13.0.1
Version: 22, 23 and 24 (downloaded from the website)
Samsung External T7 SSD (I can confirm the device works fine as I downloaded the whole chain in it with the other MBP)


<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->
```2022-12-06T21:04:05Z UpdateTip: new best=00000000000000000003c366fb85d272bf612692e1798f5473550f08dd166480 height=765910 version=0x31c5c000 log2_work=93.878232 tx=785535083 date='2022-12-04T22:21:16Z' progress=0.999374 cache=84.2MiB(631034txo)
2022-12-06T21:04:05Z FileCommit: fcntl F_FULLFSYNC failed: 25
2022-12-06T21:04:05Z ERROR: Flush: failed to commit file 3302
2022-12-06T21:04:05Z *** Flushing block file to disk failed. This is likely the result of an I/O error.

2022-12-06T21:04:06Z msghand thread exit
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z FileCommit: fcntl F_FULLFSYNC failed: 25
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z ERROR: SerializeFileDB: Failed to flush file /Volumes/Bitcoin/peers.adeb
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z DumpAnchors: Flush 2 outbound block-relay-only peer addresses to anchors.dat started
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z FileCommit: fcntl F_FULLFSYNC failed: 25
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z ERROR: SerializeFileDB: Failed to flush file /Volumes/Bitcoin/anchors.256c
2022-12-06T21:04:06Z DumpAnchors: Flush 2 outbound block-relay-only peer addresses to anchors.dat completed (0.00s)

title: bitcoind: "FileCommit: fcntl F_FULLFSYNC failed" on MacOS Ventura
